createGovernanceAction.creatingAGovernanceAction: Creating a Governance Action: What you need to know
createGovernanceAction.creatingAGovernanceActionDescription: To create a Governance Action, you will need to: • Fill out a form with the relevant data • Pay a refundable deposit of ₳{{deposit}} • Store the metadata of your Governance Action at your own expense. Your deposit will be refunded to your wallet when the Governance Action is either enacted or expired. The deposit will not affect your Voting Power.

description.notVerifiable: GovTool uses external sources for DRep data, and these sources are maintained by the DReps themselves. This error means that the data stored by the DRep does not match the data supplied by the DRep when they originally registered
description.dataMissing: GovTool uses external sources for DRep data, and these sources are maintained by the DReps themselves. This error means that GovTool cannot locate the data on the URL specified when the DRep was originally registered.
description.incorrectFormat: GovTool uses external sources for DRep data, and these sources are maintained by the DReps themselves. This error means that the data stored by the DRep does not match the format defined by the DRep spec.

message.notVerifiable: The data that was originally used when this DRep was created has changed.
message.dataMissing: The data that was originally used when this DRep was created has not been found.
message.incorrectFormat: The data that was originally used when this DRep was created has been formatted incorrectly.

description.notVerifiable: GovTool uses external sources for Governance Action data, and these sources are maintained by the proposers of the Actions. This error means that the data stored by the Proposer does not match the data when the Governance Action was originally posted.
description.dataMissing: GovTool uses external sources for Governance Action data, and these sources are maintained by the proposers of the Actions. This error means that GovTool cannot locate the data on the URL specified when the Governance Action was originally posted.
description.incorrectFormat: GovTool uses external sources for Governance Action data, and these sources are maintained by the proposers of the Actions. This error means that the data stored by the Proposer does not match the data format as defined by the Cardano community.

message.notVerifiable: The data that was originally used when this Governance Action was created has changed.
message.dataMissing: The data that was originally used when this Governance Action was created has not been found.
message.incorrectFormat: The data that was originally used when this Governance Action was created has been formatted incorrectly.

hero.description:
Cardano Governance lets Ada holders have a say in the network's future.

You can vote directly, find someone to represent you, or become a representative for others.

You can also propose changes in the network yourself, put these up for discussion and eventually, a vote.

<0>Learn more about governance</0> in the guide, or have a look around the app and see Cardano Governance in action.
hero.headline:
Cardano 
 Governance Tool

externalDataDoesntMatch.message:
GovTool checks the URL you entered to see if the JSON file that you self-host matches the one that was generated in GovTool. To complete registration, this match must be exact.

In this case, there is a mismatch. You can go back to the data edit screen and try the process again.
externalDataDoesntMatch.title: Your External Data Does Not Match the Original File.

registration.addInformationDescription: You can include extra information about yourself by adding a URL and its hash.

alreadyRegistered.title: You already are a DRep
alreadyRegistered.description:
Looks like you have already successfully completed your registration and you currently are a DRep.

You can view your details in the DRep Directory.

registration.descriptionStepTwo:
By clicking register you create your DRep ID within your wallet and become a DRep.

Once the registration has completed your DRep ID will be shown on your dashboard. You will be able to share your DRep ID so that other ada holders can delegate their voting power to you.
registration.rolesAndResponsibilitiesDescription: DReps are fundamental users that govern the Cardano network. This is an important role which requires work and dedication to fulfil. A DRep is expected to actively participate in governance and act as a representative of other Cardano members in governance matters. Therefore, DReps will be expected to keep abreast of Governance Actions so they can make informed and wise decisions. <0>Learn More about DRep. Please register as a DRep if you have time to dedicate to making Cardano a better and more well-governed place. Becoming a DRep will require a refundable deposit of ₳{{deposit}}. You will be refunded your deposit when you retire.
registration.storeDataCheckboxLabel: I agree to store correctly this information and to maintain them over the years
registration.storeDataTitle: Store and maintain the data yourself
registration.storingInformationDescription: Download your file, save it to your chosen location, and enter the URL of that location in step 3
registration.storingInformationStep2Label: Save this file in a location that provides a public URL (e.g. github)

notADRep.title: You are not a DRep
notADRep.description: Looks like you cannot retire, because currently you are not a DRep.

retirement.whatRetirementMeansDescription:
By retiring you are giving up your voting rights. Voting Power that is delegated to you will remain in place.

ADA Holders that have delegated to be able to see that you are retired in the DRep directory. They will be able to re-delegate their Voting Power to another DRep.

You can still participate in Governance by proposing Governance Actions, by delegating your personal Voting Power to another DRep, or by coming out of retirement, and assuming your previous role as a DRep.

If you come out of retirement, your DRep ID will be the same as it was before retirement, and your Voting Power will consist of your own Ada balance and what delegated power that remains associated
to your DRep ID.

alreadyRegistered.title: You already are a Direct Voter
alreadyRegistered.description: Looks like you have already successfully completed your registration and you currently are a Direct Voter.

notDirectVoter.title: You are not a Direct Voter
notDirectVoter.description: Looks like you cannot retire, because currently you are not a Direct Voter.

directVoter.registerDescription: A Direct Voter is someone that can vote on any Governance Action with their own Voting Power. They do not wish to campaign for delegations from others or be shown via the DRep Directory. <0>Learn More about Direct Voter. Direct Voters are not explicitly supported by the protocol but are instead an abstraction over the on-chain DReps. Direct Voters are not expected to link and host metadata. Becoming a Direct Voter will require a refundable deposit of ₳{{deposit}}. Your deposit will be refunded if you retire. You can decide to become a DRep at anytime if you are a Direct Voter you will not need to pay another deposit.
directVoter.retirementDescription:
By Retiring you are giving up your Voting Power. You will not be able to vote on any Governance Actions. Your deposit of {{deposit}} ada will be refunded.

You can at any time in the future re-register to become a Direct Voter, or you can delegate your Voting Power to someone else, or become a DRep.

These options are listed in our Guides here: <0>Voting options and Roles</0>

system.description: The Cardano GovTool is a tool that allows you to participate in the governance of the Cardano network. You can propose, vote on, and delegate your voting power to other users.
system.title: This tool is connected to {{networkName}}
system.bootstrappingWarning: Govtool is in the Bootstrapping phase. Some features are not available. <docs>Learn more</docs>

abstain.heading: Abstaining
abstain.paragraphOne: Select this to signal no confidence in the current constitutional committee by voting NO on every proposal and voting YES to no-confidence proposals.

noConfidence.heading: No confidence
noConfidence.paragraphOne: If you don’t have trust in the current constitutional committee you signal ‘No-confidence’. By voting ‘No’ means you don’t want governance actions to be ratified.

todRep.heading: Delegation to DRep
todRep.paragraphOne: DReps are representatives of the ada holders that can vote on governance actions.

toMyself.heading: Delegate to myself
toMyself.paragraphOne: If you are registered as DRep you can delegate your voting power on yourself.

expiryDate.heading: Expiry Date
expiryDate.paragraphOne: The date when the governance action will expiry if it doesn’t reach ratification thresholds.
expiryDate.paragraphTwo: IMPORTANT: If the governance action is ratified before the expiry date it will be considered ratified and it will not be available to vote on afterwards.

submissionDate.heading: Submission Date
submissionDate.paragraphOne: The date when the governance action was submitted on-chain.

votingPower.heading: DRep Voting Power
votingPower.paragraphOne: This is the voting power delegated to you as a DRep and it is calculated at the end of every epoch for the epoch that just ended.
votingPower.paragraphTwo: IMPORTANT: When voting, the voting power provides an indication and not the exact number.
